p: As a result of the outbreak of pneumonia caused by the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV), Wuhan, the capital of Hubei province in China, became a focus of global attention. After the first case of coronavirus was reported in Wuhan in December 2019, which was not the source of the virus, the coronavirus spread to domestic and foreign areas, resulting in a significant threat to the world. The 2019-nCoV situation reports, published by the World Health Organization (WHO) on 25 February 2020, show that 77,780 cases had been confirmed in China. Outside of China, the number of confirmed cases was 2459, and 2700 infected patients had died [ 1]. Consequently, the WHO has classified the 2019-nCoV epidemic as a public health emergency of international concern. China and other affected countries have adopted a series of response measures to prevent and control this extraordinary public safety event [ 2].
